About the Workshop

Location & Venue

The workshop will be held in Montreal, Canada, as part of the IJCAI 2025 conference. Montreal is a vibrant city known for its rich cultural heritage, world-class universities, and thriving AI research community.

Montreal, Canada

August 16th â€“ 22nd, 2025

Venue details will be announced soon

Workshop Objectives

The IJCAI 2025 Workshop on Causal Learning for Recommendation Systems aims to bring together researchers and practitioners from both academia and industry to explore the intersection of causal inference and recommendation systems. Our objectives include:

  • Advancing the understanding of causal relationships in recommendation systems
  • Developing novel methods for incorporating causal reasoning into recommendation algorithms
  • Addressing challenges in fairness, bias, and interpretability through causal approaches
  • Fostering collaboration between causal inference and recommendation system communities

Target Audience

This workshop is designed for:

  • Researchers in recommendation systems and causal inference
  • Industry practitioners working on recommendation systems
  • Graduate students interested in the intersection of these fields
  • Anyone interested in improving recommendation systems through causal reasoning

Workshop Format

The workshop will feature:

  • Invited talks from leading researchers in the field
  • Paper presentations and discussions
  • Interactive sessions and panel discussions
  • Networking opportunities with experts in the field

Expected Outcomes

By the end of the workshop, participants will:

  • Gain insights into the latest developments in causal learning for recommendations
  • Understand practical challenges and solutions in implementing causal approaches
  • Have opportunities to network with researchers and practitioners in the field
  • Contribute to shaping the future direction of causal learning in recommendation systems
